001package imagingbook.calibration.zhang;
002
003import imagingbook.calibration.zhang.util.MathUtil;
004import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
005import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d.PntDouble;
006import imagingbook.common.geometry.mappings.Mapping2D;
007import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix;
008
009/**
010 * <p>
011 * This class represents a special geometric mapping for  rectifying (i.e., removing the lens distortion from) an image,
012 * given the associated camera parameters. The transformation maps any position {@code x'} in the rectified image to the
013 * corresponding position {@code x} in the original (distorted) image. The mapping is implicitly inverted, i.e., maps
014 * target to source image coordinates.
015 * </p>
016 * <p>
017 * Typically usage (by target-to-source-mapping):
018 * </p>
019 * <pre>
020 * ImageProcessor original = ... ;  // the distorted image
021 * ImageProcessor rectified = ... ; // the (new) rectified image
022 * mapping.applyTo(original, rectified, InterpolationMethod.Bicubic);
023 * </pre>
024 */
025public class RectificationMapping implements Mapping2D {
026        private final Camera cam;
027        private final RealMatrix Ai;    // inverse of the intrinsic camera matrix (2 x 3)
028
029        public RectificationMapping (Camera cam) {
030//              this.isInverseFlag = true;      // maps target -> source
031                this.cam = cam;
032                this.Ai = cam.getInverseA();
033        }
034
035        @Override
036        public Pnt2d applyTo(Pnt2d uv) {
037                // (u,v) is an observed sensor point
038                // apply the inverse camera mapping to get the normalized (x,y) point:
039                double[] xy = Ai.operate(MathUtil.toHomogeneous(uv.toDoubleArray()));
040                // apply the camera's radial lens distortion in the normalized plane:
041                double[] xyd = cam.warp(xy);
042                // apply the (forward) camera mapping to get the undistorted sensor point (u',v'):
043                return PntDouble.from(cam.mapToSensorPlane(xyd));
044        }
045
046}
